Posts.Content: LMB71203 wrote: Hello Everyone, I am new to all of this and joined for a little support. I went for my first mammogram last week and was told that indeterminate calcifications were found. I returned for a compression mammogram and an ultrasound. The Radiologist said the area did not look suspicious but she could not tell anything from the films. I am having a biopsy on Thursday and I am scared. If the area was not suspicious, then why a biopsy? Surely the Radiologist would not just tell me it did not look suspicious - would she? I had a breast reduction in December 2011 - could these calcifications stem from that surgery? Â How worried should I be? Log in to post a reply
